text:
I am implementing a loader for bundler files from Structure from Motion and integrating it with FileIO. Somehow, the `skipmagic`  function does not work as I expcted. I add the loader with
```add_format(format"OUT", "# Bundle file v0.3", ".out", [:BundlerIO])```
but after calling `skipmagic` , the next char I read is the linebreak, which cost me quite some time. Is this expected behavior? Should I add the linebreak to the magic? Now I added a really ugly `read(s, 1)`  to fix this. And really bothers me :joy:
Any ideas/hints here?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/55465| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
Hey <@U019078LDND>, if you were able to find an answer here on Slack, please cross post it to Discourse via the link above. Thank you!
